usefulItems: large plate, large bowl, bowl, plastic wrap, small bowl, serving platter, refrigerator
title: Prawn salad with horseradish cream

ingredients.content: 500 g kipfler potatoes (small), cut into halves
24 large raw prawn cutlets, de-veined, with tails intact
1 ½ tbsp extra virgin olive oil
40 g eschalots, cut into fine dice
150 g fresh Lebanese cucumbers (approx. 3), peeled, deseeded and cut into fine dice
½ bunch baby radishes, cut into quarters

preparations.content: Place water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma dish into position and weigh potatoes into dish. Secure Varoma lid and steam <b>15 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>.
Insert Varoma tray and place prawns onto tray. Secure Varoma lid and steam <b>7 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>. Transfer prawns onto a plate and allow to cool.

Check to see if potatoes are cooked. If still hard, cook for a further <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>. Transfer potatoes into a large bowl. Season with salt, add vinegar and oil and toss to coat. Add eschalots and toss to combine. Set aside and allow to cool to room temperature. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh cucumbers into it. Set bowl aside.

Place sugar, vinegar and water into mixing bowl and cook <b>3 min/80°C/speed 3<b>. Transfer into bowl with cucumbers and set aside to cool. Once cooled, cover and place into refrigerator until ready to use. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
<b>Insert butterfly whisk.<b> Place cream into mixing bowl and beat <b>30 sec/speed 3.5<b>.
Add horseradish, crème fraîche, pepper and salt and mix <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then blend 30 sec/speed 3. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place peppercorns (optional) into mixing bowl and grind <b>20 sec/speed 8<b>. Transfer into a small bowl and set aside.

Transfer reserved potatoes and prawns onto a large platter. Drain reserved cucumbers and sprinkle over potatoes. Dot with Horseradish cream. Add radishes, ground pink pepper (optional), chervil and salmon caviar (optional). Serve immediately, with extra Horseradish cream.

hintsAndTricks: This recipe uses jarred horseradish. You can use fresh horseradish if you prefer. Simply place 50 g fresh horseradish into mixing bowl and grate <b>5 sec/speed 7. <b>Scrape down sides of mixing bowl and grate <b>4 sec/speed 7. <b>Use horseradish as per recipe.
Leftover horseradish cream is delicious with rare roast beef, cold meat and roast potatoes.
